result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney E Bigel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment as may be feasible. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. No contact with any known drug dealers or users. Do not drive unless properly licensed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtney E Bigel

New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.
